page.title: 03CHILDERDITCH COMMON AREA
page.content: Childerditch is an undulating rural area which is within easy reach of Brentwood. It is dominated by common and arable farmland, overlooked by the wooded area of Thorndon Park. Many of the farms shown on the map are no longer working farms, and in some instances the land has been sold off or rented out. Housing is either private or agricultural.The centre of the village is the village hall, which was once the local school. It is used as a play school, youth centre and for meetings. The main crops being grown are wheat and oil-seed rape. The housing is varied, ranging from large detached residences to very small bungalows.The main attraction is "The Greyhound", a large Public house, overlooking the Common. The roads are narrow and windy, hedged on either side.
